metadata.title: CVE-2016-7798 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The openssl gem for Ruby uses the same initialization vector (IV) in GCMMode (aes-*-gcm) when the IV is set before the key, which makes it easierfor context-dependent attackers to bypass the encryption protectionmechanism.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7798` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.3
libtcltk-ruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.3
ri1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.3
ruby1.9.1 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.3
ruby1.9.1-examples - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.3
ruby1.9.1-full - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.3
ruby1.9.3 - 1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.3
No subscription required

libruby2.0 - 2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.4
ruby2.0 - 2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.4
ruby2.0-tcltk - 2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ruby1.9.1 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9.3.484-2ubuntu1.3').
ruby2.0 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.4').
